a-boss-is-a-system-of-mistrust.text: A boss is a system of mistrust.

a-donkey-carrying-a-pile-of-holy-books-i.text: A donkey carrying a pile of holy books is still a donkey.

a-fact-may-be-true-even-if-you-dont-like.text: A fact may be true even if you don't like it.

a-man-is-a-success-if-he-gets-up-in-the-.text: A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and gets to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.

a-novel-is-a-prose-narrative-of-some-len.text: A novel is a prose narrative of some length that has something wrong with it.

a-philosopher-is-a-sort-of-intellectual-.text: A philosopher is a sort of intellectual yokel who gawks at things that sensible people take for granted.

a-poem-begins-as-a-lump-in-the-throat-a-.text: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness.

a-written-word-is-the-choicest-of-relics.text: A written word is the choicest of relics. It is something at once more intimate with us and more universal than any other work of art.

act-the-way-youd-like-to-be-and-soon-you.text: Act the way you'd like to be and soon you'll be the way you act.

all-civilization-is-based-on-the-develop.text: All civilization is based on the development of consciousness.

all-of-our-technology-is-an-excretion-of.text: All of our technology is an excretion of the imagination.

all-of-our-technology-is-the-condensatio.text: All of our technology is the condensation of ideological intention.

all-the-things-that-truly-matter-beauty-.text: All the things that truly matter—beauty, love, creativity, joy, inner peace—arise from beyond the mind.

and-indeed-empty-mind-perception-is-abse.text: And indeed, empty-mind perception is Absence looking out at Presence. This is Taoism's way of describing the Cosmos looking out at itself…

and-the-time-will-come-when-you-see-were.text: And the time will come when you see we're all one and life flows on within and without you.

any-effort-that-has-self-glorification-a.text: Any effort that has self-glorification as its final endpoint is bound to end in disaster.

arguing-involves-thoughts-of-victory-or-.text: Arguing involves thoughts of victory or defeat and is contrary to the Way of the Buddha.

art-is-long-life-short.note: In the tunnel under Amsterdam's Rijksmuseum

ask-yourself-what-am-i-doing-about-my-an.text: Ask yourself, what am I doing about my anger, my attachment, my pride, my jealousy? These are the things we should check in our daily lives.

awareness-is-the-greatest-agent-for-chan.text: Awareness is the greatest agent for change.

be-in-zen-meditation-whether-you-are-wor.text: Be in Zen meditation whether you are working or sitting; be essentially at peace whether you are speaking, silent, active or still.

be-yourself-everyone-else-is-already-tak.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

being-a-songwriter-is-about-picking-up-t.text: Being a songwriter is about picking up the baton and holding it for a while and then passing it on.

being-spiritual-has-nothing-to-do-with-w.text: Being spiritual has nothing to do with what you believe, and everything to do with your state of consciousness.

beyond-random-acts-of-kindness-comes-per.text: Beyond random acts of kindness comes perpetual kindness.

boredom-is-simply-a-lack-of-attention.text: Boredom is simply a lack of attention.

boredom-is-the-other-side-of-creativity.text: Boredom is the other side of creativity

breathing-in-i-see-myself-as-still-water.text: Breathing in, I see myself as still water. Breathing out, I reflect things as they are.

buddhist-philosophy-is-so-universal-and-.text: Buddhist philosophy is so universal and logical that it is not just the philosophy of Buddhism, but of life itself.

buddhist-philosophy-life-as-ordinarily-l.text: Buddhist philosophy: Life as ordinarily lived is a kind of illusion, and you can’t be truly free until you pierce the illusion and look into the heart of things.

calmness-of-mind-does-not-mean-you-shoul.text: Calmness of mind does not mean you should stop your activity. Real calmness should be found in activity itself.

cheeky-chattering-is-useless-and-idle.text: Cheeky chattering is useless and idle
cheeky-chattering-is-useless-and-idle.note: In the tunnel under Amsterdam's Rijksmuseum

choose-to-be-optimistic-it-feels-better.text: Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.

civilized-dialog-is-our-last-best-hope-t.text: Civilized dialog is our last best hope.... The best idea will win.

colors-are-the-deeds-and-sufferings-of-l.text: Colors are the deeds and sufferings of light.

computers-are-drugs-too-large-to-swallow.text: Computers are drugs too large to swallow

consciousness-is-the-one-thing-in-this-u.text: Consciousness is the one thing in this universe that cannot be an illusion.

creative-ideas-will-come-to-you-in-the-q.text: Creative ideas will come to you in the quiet moment in between your thoughts. You are wiser than you think. Be still and see what happens.

death-is-a-stripping-away-of-all-that-is.text: Death is a stripping away of all that is not you. The secret of life is to 'die before you die' and find that there is no death.

death-is-not-the-opposite-of-life-life-h.text: Death is not the opposite of life. Life has no opposite. The opposite of death is birth. Life is eternal.

death-is-sweet-it-delivers-us-from-the-f.text: Death is sweet; it delivers us from the fear of death.

did-you-hear-their-words-or-did-you-hear.text: Did you hear their words, or did you hear their *tone*?

do-not-grow-old-no-matter-how-long-you-l.text: Do not grow old, no matter how long you live. Never cease to stand like curious children before the great mystery into which we are born.

do-not-search-for-the-truth-only-cease-t.text: Do not search for the truth; only cease to hold opinions.

do-not-seek-the-truth-only-cease-to-cher.text: Do not seek the truth, only cease to cherish your opinions.

dont-keep-searching-for-the-truth-just-l.text: Don't keep searching for the truth, just let go of your opinions.

dont-think-it-wont-happen-just-because-i.text: Don’t think it won’t happen just because it hasn’t happened yet.

dont-trust-your-thought-when-you-are-dep.text: Don't trust your thought when you are depressed. It is highly unlikely that it is true. Whatever you are depressed about won't last forever.

drink-your-tea-slowly-and-reverently-as-.text: Drink your tea slowly and reverently, as if it is the axis on which the whole earth revolves – slowly, evenly, without rushing toward the future.

each-time-that-we-open-ourselves-to-dive.text: Each time that we open ourselves to diversity and ponder that which is different from us, we enlarge the richness and intelligence of the human race.

emptiness-is-in-fact-the-reservoir-of-in.text: Emptiness is in fact the reservoir of infinite possibilities.

ending-a-sentence-with-a-preposition-is.text: Ending a sentence with a preposition is something up with which I will not put.

eternity-is-a-long-time-especially-towar.text: Eternity is a long time, especially towards the end.

every-day-priests-minutely-examine-the-l.text: Every day, priests minutely examine the Law and endlessly chant complicated sutras. Before doing that, though, they should learn how to read the love letters sent by the wind and rain, the snow and moon.

every-moment-of-the-day-indeed-every-mom.text: Every moment of the day—indeed, every moment throughout one's life—offers an opportunity to be relaxed and responsive or to suffer unnecessarily.

every-movement-every-glance-every-though.text: Every movement, every glance, every thought, and every word can be infused with love.

every-once-in-a-while-my-wife-doubts-my.text: Every once in a while, my wife doubts my importance.

every-thing-only-happens-once-it-never-r.text: Every thing only happens once; it never repeats itself.

everything-contains-a-reward-of-some-kin.text: Everything contains a reward of some kind. It's your job to find it.

everything-i-have-done-or-felt-has-been-.text: Everything I have done or felt has been in some way influenced by the impact of the Natural Scene.

everything-we-think-feel-and-do-has-an-e.text: Everything we think, feel, and do has an effect on our ancestors and future generations and reverberates throughout the cosmos.

everywhere-i-go-i-find-a-poet-has-been-t.text: Everywhere I go I find a poet has been there before me.

fear-is-a-natural-reaction-to-moving-clo.text: Fear is a natural reaction to moving closer to the truth.

fiction-is-the-lie-through-which-we-tell.text: Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth.

find-your-place-on-the-planet-dig-in-and.text: Find your place on the planet. Dig in, and take responsibility from there.

follow-the-stream-have-faith-in-its-cour.text: Follow the stream, have faith in its course.

forgiveness-requires-a-sense-that-bad-be.text: Forgiveness requires a sense that bad behavior is a sign of suffering rather than malice.

give-me-your-tired-your-poor-your-huddle.text: Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free.
give-me-your-tired-your-poor-your-huddle.attribution: Emma Lazarus (inscribed of the Statue of Liberty). This is what we once stood for as a nation. Seeking purity we stain ourselves, Turning to anger we stir hatred all around.

great-spirits-have-always-encountered-vi.text: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.

handle-a-single-leaf-in-such-a-way-that-.text: Handle a single leaf in such a way that it manifests the body of Buddha. This in turn allows Buddha to manifest through the leaf.

handling-our-suffering-is-an-art-if-we-k.text: Handling our suffering is an art. If we know how to suffer, we suffer much less, and we're no longer afraid of being overwhelmed by the suffering inside.

happiness-held-is-the-seed-happiness-sha.text: Happiness held is the seed; happiness shared is the flower.

hospice-care-is-not-a-matter-of-giving-u.text: Hospice care is not a matter of giving up. It’s a decision to shift our efforts from shoring up a body on the verge of the end to providing solace to a soul that’s on the cusp of forever.

how-much-ego-do-you-need-just-enough-so-.text: How much ego do you need? Just enough so that you don't step in front of a bus.

how-strange-that-nature-does-not-knock-a.text: How strange that Nature does not knock, and yet does not intrude!

i-am-sometimes-so-wrapped-up-in-my-work-.text: I am sometimes so wrapped up in my work that I forget about the noon meal.

i-am-the-beginning-and-the-end-this-is-s.text: 'I am the beginning and the end.' This is said to us who live in the bondage of time, who have to face the end, who cannot escape the past, who need a present to stand upon.

i-am-walking-not-merely-on-matter-but-on.text: I am walking not merely on matter, but on spirit.

i-believe-religion-to-be-deeply-personal.text: I believe religion to be deeply personal; I am a loner with my particular amorphous sense of deity.

i-believe-that-walking-has-played-a-much.text: I believe that walking has played a much more meaningful role in human health than all of the medicines that have been consumed throughout history.

i-can-see-only-one-thing-to-do-make-the.text: I can see only one thing to do—make the photography as clean, as decisive, and as honest as possible.

i-could-not-be-a-poet-without-the-natura.text: I could not be a poet without the natural world. Someone else could. But not me. For me the door to the woods is the door to the temple.

i-do-not-fear-death-i-had-been-dead-for-.text: I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it.

i-dont-let-go-of-my-thoughts-i-meet-them.text: I don't let go of my thoughts, I meet them with understanding, then they let go of me.

i-have-beliefs-of-course-like-everyone-b.text: I have beliefs, of course, like everyone—but I don't always believe in them.

i-have-found-that-if-you-love-life-life-.text: I have found that if you love life, life will love you back.

i-have-no-special-talent-i-am-only-passi.text: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.

i-like-to-think-of-constraints-for-creat.text: I like to think of constraints for creativity as barriers that lead to breakthroughs.

i-make-a-painting-out-of-love-a-profound.text: I make a painting out of love. A profound love, which includes respect, admiration, desire, need—all of the things that go into being a human, wanting to communicate to another human and connect to another human. I call that love. And so I make a painting out of love. And I'm seeking love in return. I want that to come back in that way.

i-remove-my-glasses-pull-a-stocking-cap-.text: I remove my glasses, pull a stocking cap down over my eyes, and type the first draft single-spaced on the yellow paper in the actual and metaphysical darkness behind my closed eyes, trying to avoid being distracted by syntax or diction or punctuation or grammar or spelling or word choice or anything else that would block the immediate delivery of the story.

i-should-know-better-by-now-but-i-am-sti.text: I should know better by now but I am still surprised when a person important to me dies.

i-think-i-cannot-preserve-my-health-and-.text: I think I cannot preserve my health and spirits unless I spend four hours a day at least—and it is commonly more than that—sauntering through the woods and over the hills and fields, absolutely free from all wordly engagements.

i-used-to-go-after-a-song-seek-it-out-bu.text: I used to go after a song, seek it out. But now, instead of going to it, I stay where I am and let everything disappear and the song rushes to me.

if-in-our-daily-life-we-can-smile-if-we-.text: If in our daily life we can smile, if we can be peaceful and happy, not only we, but everyone will profit from it. This is the most basic kind of peace work.

if-there-isnt-anything-why-would-i-be-so.text: If there isn't anything, why would I be so certain that there is?

if-we-are-facing-in-the-right-direction-.text: If we are facing in the right direction, all we have to do is keep on walking.

if-we-could-see-the-miracle-of-a-single-.text: If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.

if-we-could-see-the-whole-truth-of-any-s.text: If we could see the whole truth of any situation, our only response would be one of compassion.

if-you-are-unable-to-find-the-truth-righ.text: If you are unable to find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?

if-you-concentrate-on-a-figure-you-tend-.text: If you concentrate on a figure, you tend to ignore the background.

if-you-have-an-understanding-and-cannot-.text: If you have an understanding and cannot express it, then your understanding is not yet complete.

if-you-propose-to-speak-always-ask-yours.text: If you propose to speak, always ask yourself: Is it true? Is it necessary? Is it kind?

if-you-realize-that-all-things-change-th.text: If you realize that all things change, there is nothing you will try to hold on to.

if-you-truly-love-nature-you-will-find-b.text: If you truly love nature, you will find beauty everywhere.

if-you-try-to-expel-the-delusion-it-will.text: If you try to expel the delusion it will only persist the more, and your mind will become busier and busier trying to cope with it. That is not so good. Just say, 'Oh, this is just delusion,' and do not be bothered by it.

if-your-mind-is-calm-and-constant-you-ca.text: If your mind is calm and constant, you can keep yourself away from the noisy world even though you are in the midst of it. In the midst of noise and change, your mind will be quiet and stable.

if-your-nerve-deny-you-go-above-your-ner.text: If your Nerve, deny you—Go above your Nerve

in-all-affairs-of-life-at-every-moment-w.text: In all affairs of life, at every moment, we have a choice.

in-all-things-of-nature-there-is-somethi.text: In all things of nature, there is something of the marvelous.

in-fellow-there-into-th-hovel-keep-thee-.text: In, fellow, there, into th' hovel; keep thee warm.

in-seed-time-learn-in-harvest-teach-in-w.text: In seed time learn, in harvest teach, in winter enjoy.

in-truth-there-was-only-one-christian-an.text: In truth, there was only one christian and he died on the cross.

in-zazen-one-is-ones-present-self-what-o.text: In zazen, one is one's present self, what one was, and what one will be, all at once.

insight-into-the-nature-of-time-is-a-key.text: Insight into the nature of time is a key to understanding Zen.

inspiration-rises-out-of-a-willingness-t.text: Inspiration rises out of a willingness to accept it.

it-is-almost-impossible-to-talk-about-bu.text: It is almost impossible to talk about Buddhism.

it-is-important-to-expect-nothing-to-tak.text: It is important to expect nothing, to take every experience, including the negative ones, as merely steps on the path, and to proceed.

it-is-not-wise-to-rush-about-if-too-much.text: It is not wise to rush about. If too much energy is used, exhaustion follows. This is not the way of Tao.

it-is-only-with-the-heart-that-one-can-s.text: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.

it-is-perception-that-refracts-the-dimen.text: It is perception that refracts the dimensions here.

it-is-stupid-to-contradict-a-belief-acce.text: It is stupid to contradict a belief accepted by everyone over a very long time for extremely strong reasons, unless the naysayer uses more powerful and incontrovertible proofs, and completely rebuts the opposed reasoning. Copernicus does not do this at all.

it-is-the-eternal-now-which-provides-for.text: It is the eternal now which provides for us a temporal now.

its-a-gift-to-exist-and-with-existence-c.text: It's a gift to exist and with existence comes suffering. There's no escaping that.

its-easy-to-have-calmness-in-inactivity-.text: It's easy to have calmness in inactivity, and hard to have calmness in activity, but calmness in activity is true calmness.

its-easy-to-make-someone-feel-special-as.text: It's easy to make someone feel special. Ask open-ended questions and listen with genuine interest. Attention is the expression of love.

its-impossible-to-experience-anxiety-unl.text: It's impossible to experience anxiety unless I have attached to a thought that isn't true for me. It's that simple.

its-terribly-important-to-see-beyond-ecs.text: It's terribly important to see beyond ecstasy.

just-remain-in-the-center-watching-and-t.text: Just remain in the center; watching. And then forget that you are there.

karma-means-that-we-are-not-defined-by-o.text: Karma means that we are not defined by our situation but rather by the choices we make.

keeping-your-body-healthy-is-an-expressi.text: Keeping your body healthy is an expression of gratitude to the whole cosmos; trees, clouds, everything.

knowing-that-your-life-is-short-to-enjoy.text: Knowing that your life is short, to enjoy it day after day, moment after moment ... there is no problem. One year of life is good. One hundred years of life are good.

learn-how-to-see-realize-that-everything.text: Learn how to see. Realize that everything connects to everything else.

life-is-a-bridge-pass-over-it-but-build-.text: Life is a bridge; pass over it but build no house upon it.

like-the-birds-i-came-no-road-under-my-f.text: Like the birds I came, no road under my feet, a golden-chained gate unlocks itself.

live-simply-that-others-might-simply-liv.text: Live simply that others might simply live.

living-your-life-for-others-cherishing-t.text: Living your life for others, cherishing them with loving kindness and compassion is the door to happiness.

losing-its-name-a-river-enters-the-sea.text: losing its name, a river enters the sea

love-and-death-are-the-great-gifts-that-.text: Love and death are the great gifts that are passed onto us that most of us leave unopened.

love-by-the-way-you-walk-the-way-you-sit.text: Love by the way you walk, the way you sit, the way you eat. This world very much needs love.

love-is-a-feeling-like-a-warm-dark-stone.text: Love is a feeling like a warm, dark stone.

love-is-a-seeking-for-a-way-of-life-the-.text: Love is a seeking for a way of life; the way that cannot be followed alone; the resonance of all spiritual and physical things.

man-has-free-will-to-the-extent-that-he-.text: Man has free will to the extent that he knows who he is—not otherwise.

many-people-think-excitement-is-happines.text: Many people think excitement is happiness.... But when you are excited you are not peaceful. True happiness is based on peace.

may-you-be-alive-at-the-end-of-the-world.text: May you be alive at the end of the world

meditation-could-be-said-to-be-the-art-o.text: Meditation could be said to be the Art of Simplicity: simply sitting, simply breathing and simply being.

memoir-is-the-last-place-youd-expect-to-.text: Memoir is the last place you'd expect to find the truth.

mindfulness-gives-you-time-time-gives-yo.text: Mindfulness gives you time. Time gives you choices. Choices, skillfully made, lead to freedom.

mindfulness-is-the-aware-balanced-accept.text: Mindfulness is the aware, balanced acceptance of the present experience. It isn't more complicated than that.

mindfulness-is-the-continuous-practice-o.text: Mindfulness is the continuous practice of deeply touching every moment of daily life.

most-creative-people-are-strongly-humani.text: Most creative people are strongly humanistic. Artists must be free to create and offer the products of their imagination and emotion to the world. They resent the restrictions of the unimaginative—the impulse to take, consume, and produce little except material things, and to profit thereby.

mozarts-music-is-so-pure-and-beautiful-t.text: Mozart's music is so pure and beautiful that I see it as a reflection of the inner beauty of the universe.

my-body-and-all-bodies-come-forth-from-t.text: My body and all bodies come forth from this whirl of energy as leaves come from trees and fish from the ocean and, most remarkably, stars from space.

my-goal-is-always-to-draw-the-straight-l.text: My goal is always to draw the straight line between where we are and where we need to be.

my-mind-can-go-in-a-thousand-directions-.text: My mind can go in a thousand directions, but on this beautiful path, I walk in peace.

my-understanding-of-the-fundamental-laws.text: My understanding of the fundamental laws of the universe did not come out of my rational mind.

never-forget-that-justice-is-what-love-l.text: Never forget that justice is what love looks like in public.

no-number-of-experiments-can-prove-me-ri.text: No number of experiments can prove me right; a single experiment can prove me wrong.

no-seed-ever-sees-the-flower.text: No seed ever sees the flower.

no-snowflake-ever-falls-in-the-wrong-pla.text: No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.

nothing-worthwhile-is-ever-achieved-with.text: Nothing worthwhile is ever achieved without danger.

often-we-cling-to-habits-that-arent-even.text: Often we cling to habits that aren't even comforting or satisfying, simply because we are unable to let go or explore new ways to do things.

once-i-got-to-my-desk-once-i-started-wri.text: Once I got to my desk, once I started writing, I still believed anything was possible.

once-we-recognize-that-all-things-are.text: Once we recognize that all things are impermanent, we have no problem enjoying them. In fact, real peace and joy are only possible when we see clearly into the nature of impermanence.

one-is-never-afraid-of-the-unknown-one-i.text: One is never afraid of the unknown; one is afraid of the known coming to an end

one-is-nothing-but-a-flow-of-change.text: One is nothing but a flow of change.

one-touch-of-nature-makes-the-whole-worl.text: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin

one-use-of-labels-is-to-file-things-away.text: One use of labels is to file things away so you don’t have to spend time on them.

only-keep-the-question-what-is-the-best-.text: Only keep the question, 'What is the best way of helping other people?'

our-father-and-mother-our-wife-and-babes.text: Our father and mother, our wife and babes, are bone of our bone and flesh of our flesh. When they die, a part of our very selves is gone.

our-life-is-momentary-and-at-the-same-ti.text: Our life is momentary, and, at the same time, each moment includes its own past and future.

our-parents-and-ancestors-are-always-wal.text: Our parents and ancestors are always walking with us. They're present in every cell of our bodies.

our-practice-cannot-be-perfect-but-witho.text: Our practice cannot be perfect, but without being discouraged by this we should continue it. This is the secret of practice.

our-role-is-not-to-understand-but-to-app.text: Our role is not to understand but to appreciate

our-thoughts-and-ideas-are-nature-just-a.text: Our thoughts and ideas are nature, just as much as waves on the ocean or clouds in the sky.

over-and-over-in-the-butterfly-we-see-th.text: Over and over in the butterfly we see the idea of transcendence. In the forest we see not the inert but the aspiring. In water that departs forever and forever returns, we experience eternity.

pain-is-not-a-punishment-pleasure-is-not.text: Pain is not a punishment; pleasure is not a reward.

people-are-always-setting-conditions-for.text: People are always setting conditions for happiness. I love life without condition.

people-have-a-hard-time-letting-go-of-su.text: People have a hard time letting go of suffering. Out of a fear of the unknown, they prefer suffering that is familiar.

people-like-us-who-believe-in-physics-kn.text: People like us, who believe in physics, know that the distinction made between past, present and future is nothing more than a persistent, stubborn illusion.

people-need-to-be-liberated-from-their-s.text: People need to be liberated from their systems of symbolism and become more intensely aware of the living vibrations of the real world.

people-who-dont-have-a-memory-dont-have-.text: People who don’t have a memory don’t have a self.

perhaps-the-flower-of-consciousness-need.text: Perhaps the flower of consciousness needs the mud from which it grows.

proper-effort-is-not-the-effort-to-make.text: Proper effort is not the effort to make something particular happen. It is the effort to be aware and awake each moment.

read-yourself-not-books-truth-isnt-outsi.text: Read yourself, not books. Truth isn't outside; that's only memory, not wisdom.

reality-is-always-the-moment-of-vision-b.text: Reality is always the moment of vision before the intellectualization takes place. There is no other reality.

replace-i-will-never-be-happy-again-with.text: Replace ‘I will never be happy again’ with ‘This shall pass.’ Everything is impermanent including this feeling of sadness and misery.

science-like-art-music-and-literature-ha.text: Science, like art, music and literature, has the capacity to amaze and excite, dazzle and bewilder. I would argue that it is that aspect of science—its cultural contribution, its humanity—that is perhaps its most important feature.

secret-virtue-means-practising-goodness-.text: 'Secret virtue' means practising goodness without any thought of recognition, neither by others nor by oneself.

share-your-knowledge-its-a-way-to-achiev.text: Share your knowledge. It's a way to achieve immortality.

software-development-productivity-has-li.text: Software development productivity has little correlation to how fast you can produce code. It's closer related to the total cost of ownership of that code. Some code, you can write in one hour, and then proceed to waste days or months maintaining and troubleshooting.

some-things-are-not-spoken-of-some-thing.text: Some things are not spoken of, some things have no name.

stay-centered-by-accepting-whatever-happ.text: Stay centered by accepting whatever happens to you. This is the ultimate.

staying-in-the-house-breeds-a-sort-of-in.text: Staying in the house breeds a sort of insanity always.

stress-is-caused-by-being-here-but-wanti.text: Stress is caused by being here but wanting to be there.

studying-zen-is-not-the-same-as-practici.text: Studying Zen is not the same as practicing Zen, just as studying aesthetics should not be confused with being an artist.

surely-if-there-is-no-reality-except-bra.text: Surely, if there is no reality except Brahman, this state of illusion is also Brahman.

talking-to-plants-is-one-way-of-talking-.text: Talking to plants is one way of talking directly to Spirit.

the-answer-the-strength-the-right-action.text: The answer, the strength, the right action or the resource will be there when you need it, not before, not after.

the-art-of-livingis-neither-careless-dri.text: The art of living…is neither careless drifting on the one hand nor fearful clinging to the past on the other. It consists in being sensitive to each moment, in regarding it as utterly new and unique, in having the mind open and wholly receptive.

the-beauty-of-zen-is-found-in-simplicity.text: The beauty of Zen is found in simplicity and tranquility, in a sense of the all-embracing harmony of things.

the-being-of-all-things-is-derived-from-.text: The being of all things is derived from the divine beauty.

the-best-way-out-is-always-through.text: The best way out is always through.

the-creative-process-is-a-process-of-sur.text: The creative process is a process of surrender, not control.

the-deep-self-one-discovers-is-the-same-.text: The deep self one discovers is the same self for all

the-difference-between-misery-and-happin.text: The difference between misery and happiness depends on what we do with our attention.

the-distinction-has-to-be-made-between.text: The distinction has to be made between skepticism and cynicism. Cynicism is a dead end. Skepticism is always justified.

the-ego-is-only-one-character-in-the-dra.text: The ego is [only] one character in the drama inside your head.

the-fact-that-we-live-at-the-bottom-of-a.text: The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be.

the-foolish-reject-what-they-see-not-wha.text: The foolish reject what they see, not what they think; the wise reject what they think, not what they see.

the-fundamental-delusion-of-humanity-is-.text: The fundamental delusion of humanity is to suppose that I am here and you are out there.

the-future-is-made-up-of-only-one-substa.text: The future is made up of only one substance and that is the present moment. By taking care of the present, you are doing everything you can to assure a good future.

the-history-of-the-idea-is-an-accident--.text: The history of the idea is an accident ... the real test in physics is experiment, and history is fundamentally irrelevant.

the-idea-of-zen-is-to-catch-life-as-it-f.text: The idea of Zen is to catch life as it flows.

the-infinite-is-in-the-finite-of-every-i.text: The infinite is in the finite of every instant.

the-inner-world-is-limitless-and-the-out.text: The inner world is limitless, and the outer world is also limitless.

the-investigation-of-the-meaning-of-word.text: The investigation of the meaning of words is the beginning of education

the-material-of-music-is-sound-and-silen.text: The material of music is sound and silence. Integrating these is composing.

the-most-beautiful-thing-we-can-experien.text: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.

the-most-precious-gift-we-can-offer-othe.text: The most precious gift we can offer others is our presence.

the-mystery-of-life-is-not-a-problem-to-.text: The mystery of life is not a problem to be solved; it is a reality to be experienced.

the-only-zen-you-find-at-the-top-of-the-.text: The only Zen you find at the top of the mountain is the Zen you bring with you.

the-opposite-of-a-great-truth-is-another.text: The opposite of a great truth is another truth.

the-past-is-present-in-us-both-as-a-curs.text: The past is present in us, both as a curse and as a blessing.

the-plants-have-enough-spirit-to-transfo.text: The plants have enough spirit to transform our limited vision

the-present-is-always-changing-the-past.text: The present is always changing the past.

the-present-moment-and-eternity-are-not.text: The present moment and eternity are not necessarily opposites. Time ceases, and both can be experienced at once.

the-process-of-awakening-is-a-journey-th.text: The process of awakening is a journey that must be taken alone.

the-purpose-of-literature-is-to-delight-.text: The purpose of literature is to Delight. To create or endorse the Scholastic is a craven desire.

the-quieter-you-become-the-more-you-can-.text: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.

the-real-miracle-is-not-to-fly-or-walk-o.text: The real miracle is not to fly or walk on fire. The real miracle is to walk on the Earth, and you can perform that miracle at any time. Just bring your mind home to your body, become alive, and perform the miracle of walking on Earth.

the-reality-you-experience-is-a-reflecti.text: The reality you experience is a reflection of what you believe is most possible.

the-result-is-not-the-point-it-is-the-ef.text: The result is not the point; it is the effort to improve ourselves that is valuable.

the-riddle-of-the-present-is-the-deepest.text: The riddle of the present is the deepest of all the riddles of time. Again, there is no answer except from that which comprises all time and lies beyond it—the eternal.

the-secret-of-life-is-learning-to-enjoy-.text: The secret of life is learning to enjoy people you don’t approve of.

the-splendor-of-the-river-is-that-it-is-.text: The splendor of the river is that it *is* the meaning and has none.

the-tao-is-made-because-we-walk-it-thing.text: The Tao is made because we walk it. Things become what they are called.

the-trouble-is-you-think-you-have-time.text: The trouble is, you think you have time.

the-truth-of-zen-is-the-truth-of-life-an.text: The truth of Zen is the truth of life, and life means to live, to move, to act, not merely to reflect.

the-truth-you-believe-and-cling-to-makes.text: The truth you believe and cling to, makes you unavailable to hear anything new.

the-universe-is-made-of-stories-not-of-a.text: The universe is made of stories, not of atoms.
the-universe-is-made-of-stories-not-of-a.note: from her poem, "The Speed of Darkness"

the-whole-art-of-poetry-is-to-say-what-c.text: The whole art of poetry is to say what can't be said.

the-whole-cosmos-has-come-together-in-or.text: The whole cosmos has come together in order to help the flower manifest herself.

the-whole-quantum-picture-says-theres-on.text: The whole quantum picture says there's only one system, the wave function of the universe.

the-whole-world-bears-your-signature.text: The whole world bears your signature.

the-wilderness-had-a-clarity-that-includ.text: The wilderness had a clarity that included me.

the-wise-adapt-themselves-to-circumstanc.text: The wise adapt themselves to circumstances, as water molds itself to the pitcher.

the-wise-one-looks-into-space-and-does-n.text: The wise one looks into space and does not regard the small as too little nor the great as too big.

the-world-reveals-itself-to-those-who-tr.text: The world reveals itself to those who travel on foot.

the-world-that-you-see-outside-you-is-a-.text: The world that you see outside you is a state of your own nervous system.

there-are-no-things-things-are-just-what.text: There are no things. Things are just what the activity of consciousness *looks like* from our localized perspective.

there-are-two-things-that-are-really-edu.text: There are two things that are really educational. One is being with a bunch of really smart people. The other is being all by yourself.

there-is-always-something-to-worry-about.text: There is always something to worry about.

there-is-another-world-but-it-is-in-this.text: There is another world, but it is in this one.

there-is-in-fact-more-earth-than-sea.text: There is, in fact, more earth than sea.

there-is-no-beginning-and-there-is-no-en.text: There is no beginning and there is no end to time. There is only your perception of time.

there-is-no-connection-between-i-myself.text: There is no connection between I myself yesterday and I myself in this moment.

there-is-no-difference-between-what-is-s.text: There is no difference between what is seen and the mind that sees it.

there-is-no-time-after-time-but-there-is.text: There is no time *after* time, but there is eternity *above* time.

there-is-only-one-_thing_-and-that-is-th.text: There is only one _thing_, and that is the universe as a whole.

there-is-simply-nothing-better-than-to-c.text: There is simply nothing better than to climb out onto a rock, and sit for hours with nothing in sight but sea and sky.

there-never-was-a-time-when-you-or-i-did.text: There never was a time when you or I did not exist. Nor will there be any future when we shall cease to be.

theres-nothing-you-can-know-that-isnt-kn.text: There's nothing you can know that isn't known, nothing you can see that isn't shown, nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be.

things-dont-just-fall-in-your-lap-you-ha.text: Things don’t just fall in your lap. You have to get your lap in the right place, at the right time, and keep your eyes and your mind open to the possibility of things falling before they fall in your lap.

thinking-is-more-interesting-than-knowin.text: Thinking is more interesting than knowing, but less interesting than looking.

thought-cant-go-where-the-roads-of-langu.text: Thought can’t go where the roads of language have not been built.

time-and-space-are-fragments-of-the-infi.text: Time and space are fragments of the infinite for the use of finite creatures.

time-is-the-moving-image-of-eternity.text: Time is the moving image of eternity

to-be-idle-is-a-short-road-to-death-and-.text: To be idle is a short road to death and to be diligent is a way of life; foolish people are idle, wise people are diligent.

to-find-a-buddha-all-you-have-to-do-is-s.text: To find a buddha, all you have to do is see your nature. Your nature is the buddha. And the buddha is the person who's free, free of plans, free of cares. If you don't see your nature and run around all day looking somewhere else, you'll never find a buddha.

to-praise-others-for-their-virtues-can-b.text: To praise others for their virtues can but encourage one's own efforts.

to-understand-reality-as-a-direct-experi.text: To understand reality as a direct experience is the reason we practice zazen, and the reason we study Buddhism.

to-understand-the-man-you-have-to-know-w.text: To understand the man you have to know what was happening in the world when he was twenty.

today-i-have-grown-taller-from-walking-w.text: Today I have grown taller from walking with the trees.

too-much-religion-is-apt-to-encourage-ev.text: Too much religion is apt to encourage evil.
too-much-religion-is-apt-to-encourage-ev.note: Alan Watts quoting a Latin verse

train-your-mind-to-see-something-good-in.text: Train your mind to see something good in everything.

trust-your-heart-if-the-seas-catch-fire-.text: Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.

use-every-distraction-as-an-object-of-me.text: Use every distraction as an object of meditation and they cease to be distractions.

useful-undertakings-which-require-sustai.text: Useful undertakings which require sustained attention and vigorous precision in order to succeed often end up by being abandoned, for, in America, as elsewhere, the people move forward by sudden impulses and short-lived efforts.

we-all-want-to-live-a-happy-life-which-i.text: We all want to live a happy life, which is our right. And the key to doing so is developing compassion for others.

we-are-awareness-our-awareness-is-not-se.text: We are awareness. Our awareness is not separate. Awareness is one name for god.

we-are-fascinated-by-the-words-but-where.text: We are fascinated by the words, but where we meet is in the silence behind them.

we-are-in-the-grip-of-a-fantastic-miracl.text: We are in the grip of a fantastic miracle.

we-ask-about-life-after-death-yet-seldom.text: We ask about life after death, yet seldom do we ask about our being before birth. But is it possible to do one without the other?

we-build-the-future-by-taking-care-of-th.text: We build the future by taking care of the present moment.

we-can-drive-mindfully-we-can-cut-carrot.text: We can drive mindfully, we can cut carrots mindfully, we can shower mindfully. When we do things this way, concentration grows. When concentration grows, we gain insight into our life.

we-cant-know-anything-outside-our-mind.text: We can't know anything outside our mind. Everything we see is contained within our mind. Thus, I am not in the world. The world is in me.

we-come-from-the-eternal-ground-of-time-.text: We come from the eternal ground of time and return to the eternal ground of time.

we-do-not-seek-for-something-besides-our.text: We do not seek for something besides ourselves. We should find the truth in this world, through our difficulties, through our suffering. This is the basic teaching of Buddhism.

we-do-not-talk-so-much-but-through-our-a.text: We do not talk so much, but through our activity we communicate with each other, intentionally or unintentionally. We should always be alert enough to communicate with or without words.

we-dont-know-anything-about-death-and-al.text: We don’t know anything about death, and all our attempts to imagine what it may or may not bring are totally meaningless.

we-have-a-choice-we-can-spend-our-whole-.text: We have a choice. We can spend our whole life suffering because we can't relax with how things really are, or we can relax and embrace the open-endedness of the human situation, which is fresh, unfixated, and unbiased.

we-have-more-possibilities-available-in-.text: We have more possibilities available in each moment than we realize.

we-live-in-an-eternal-now.text: We live in an eternal now.

we-must-be-willing-to-let-go-of-the-life.text: We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned so as to accept the life that is waiting for us.

we-need-not-come-to-the-end-of-the-path-.text: We need not come to the end of the path to experience the benefits of walking it.

we-need-to-find-out-what-is-true-so-we-c.text: We need to find out what is true so we can do what's right.

we-read-for-the-pleasure-of-thinking-ano.text: We read for the pleasure of thinking another person's thoughts.

we-take-a-handful-of-sand-from-the-endle.text: We take a handful of sand from the endless landscape of awareness around us and call that handful of sand the world.

were-actually-having-a-controlled-halluc.text: We’re actually having a controlled hallucination most of the time. We’re projecting what we expect to see, and then we’re letting reality correct it.

what-a-desolate-place-would-be-a-world-w.text: What a desolate place would be a world without a flower.

what-finally-matters-is-that-your-house-.text: What finally matters is that your house works the way you want it to. And that it is a pleasant place to be in.

what-opens-our-minds-and-shows-the-limit.text: What opens our minds and shows the limits of our ideas is an encounter with other people, other cultures, other ideas.

what-you-do-makes-a-difference-and-you-h.text: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.

whatever-you-do-do-it-slowly-and-intenti.text: Whatever you do, do it slowly and intentionally. You will enjoy it more and become happier.

whatever-you-think-the-world-is-withhold.text: Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world.

whats-so-funny-bout-peace-love-and-under.text: What's so funny ’bout peace, love, and understanding?

when-i-am-sipping-tea-this-very-moment-o.text: When I am sipping tea, this very moment of my lifting the bowl to my lips is eternity itself transcending time and space.

when-i-die-i-expect-to-be-very-impressed.text: When I die, I expect to be very impressed with what follows.

when-many-demons-are-struggling-inside-y.text: When many demons are struggling inside you, the one that you feed is the one that will become the strongest. You alone are responsible for what you feed.

when-one-does-not-understand-death-life-.text: When one does not understand death, life can be very confusing.

when-someone-does-something-i-dont-like-.text: When someone does something I don’t like, rather than obsess over it and hold a grudge, I’m trying to learn a lesson. This person is showing me what I don’t wanna be and how I don’t wanna act. That’s kind of beautiful.

when-we-wake-up-from-our-confused-state-.text: When we wake up from our confused state of mind, that is enlightenment.

when-you-attain-wholeness-everything-wil.text: When you attain wholeness, everything will flock to you.

when-you-feel-overwhelmed-and-busy-remem.text: When you feel overwhelmed and busy, remember that you are not powerless. When your mind rests, the world also rests.

when-you-get-senior-enough-most-jobs-eve.text: When you get senior enough, most jobs eventually converge to reading, writing, and speaking. Worth investing early on in learning how to do those three things well.

whenever-something-negative-happens-to-y.text: Whenever something negative happens to you, there is a deep lesson concealed within it.

where-one-has-no-history-you-have-cultur.text: Where one has no history, you have culture.

where-there-is-peace-and-meditation-ther.text: Where there is peace and meditation, there is neither anxiety nor doubt.

whereof-one-cannot-speak-thereof-one-mus.text: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must remain silent.

wherever-you-are-you-are-one-with-the-cl.text: Wherever you are, you are one with the clouds and one with the sun and the stars you see. You are one with everything. That is more true than I can say, and more true than you can hear.

whether-you-have-a-problem-in-your-life-.text: Whether you have a problem in your life or not depends upon your own attitude, your own understanding

why-are-creative-writers-constantly-told.text: Why are creative writers constantly told ‘Write fast and edit later’ instead of ‘Write to your strengths’? Writing badly makes me anxious. Honing as I go feels right.

why-should-a-situation-such-as-this-crea.text: Why should a situation such as this create a lasting revelation? Some might say that such memories are deja vu, that we are building castles of imagination and nostalgic affirmations. I do not believe this. I feel that such events as this and the night I realized my parents' unhappiness offer a glimpse into a world-pattern beyond our conscious awareness.

with-your-full-mind-you-form-the-mudra-i.text: With your full mind you form the mudra in your hands.

with-your-reaction-to-each-experience-yo.text: With your reaction to each experience, you create the karma that will color your future. It is up to you whether this new karma is positive or negative. You simply have to pay attention at the right moment.

without-knowing-the-origin-of-things-we-.text: Without knowing the origin of things we cannot appreciate the result of our life’s effort.

would-it-not-be-better-to-pull-the-rolli.text: Would it not be better to pull the rolling wagon to its destination with united effort?
would-it-not-be-better-to-pull-the-rolli.note: writing to Galileo Galilei in 1597 C.E., trying to persuade him to join the pre-Copernican movement.

writing-is-nothing-anybody-can-write-rea.text: Writing is nothing; anybody can write really … if they got dreams at an early age.

yoga-is-sometimes-the-worlds-most-elabor.text: Yoga is sometimes the world's most elaborate way of postponing liberation.

you-can-count-the-seeds-in-an-apple-but-.text: You can count the seeds in an apple, but you can’t count the apples in a seed.

you-can-worship-gods-but-you-cannot-wors.text: You can worship gods, but you cannot worship Tao.

you-exist-in-your-brain-and-i-exist-in-m.text: You exist in your brain and I exist in my brain

you-have-to-know-how-to-accept-rejection.text: You have to know how to accept rejection and reject acceptance.

you-may-have-a-million-desires-to-be-in-.text: You may have a million desires to be in other places, doing other things, but you are not there, you are here.

you-must-not-fool-yourself-and-you-are-t.text: You must not fool yourself, and you are the easiest person to fool.

you-should-not-mistake-medicine-for-food.text: You should not mistake medicine for food. Sometimes medicine is necessary, but it should not become our food.

you-should-sit-and-meditate-for-twenty-m.text: You should sit and meditate for twenty minutes, unless you're too busy, then you should sit and meditate for an hour.

you-will-not-be-punished-for-your-anger-.text: You will not be punished for your anger; you will be punished by your anger.

your-life-is-not-your-own-it-is-the-dele.text: Your life is not your own—it is the delegated adaptability of Tao.
your-life-is-not-your-own-it-is-the-dele.note: retelling a Chuang Tzu (aka Zhuang Zhou, or Zhuangzi) story

your-mind-is-not-in-your-head-your-head-.text: Your mind is not in your head, your head is in your mind.

your-work-is-to-discover-your-world-and-.text: Your work is to discover your world and then with all your heart give yourself to it.

zen-does-not-confuse-spirituality-with-t.text: Zen does not confuse spirituality with thinking about God while one is peeling potatoes. Zen spirituality is just to peel the potatoes.

zen-has-no-business-with-ideas.text: Zen has no business with ideas.

zen-has-no-secrets-other-than-seriously-.text: Zen has no secrets other than seriously thinking about birth-and-death.

zen-is-a-way-of-liberation-concerned-not.text: Zen is a way of liberation, concerned not with discovering what is good or bad or advantageous, but what is.

zen-is-an-experience-actual-and-personal.text: Zen is an experience actual and personal, and not a knowledge to be gained by analysis or comparison.

zen-is-not-a-philosophy-it-is-poetry-it-.text: Zen is not a philosophy, it is poetry. It does not propose, it simply persuades. It does not argue, it simply sings its own song.

zen-is-not-some-kind-of-excitement-but.text: Zen is not some kind of excitement, but concentration on our usual everyday routine.

zen-practice-is-the-direct-expression-of.text: Zen practice is the direct expression of our true nature.

zen-proposes-its-solution-by-directly-ap.text: Zen proposes its solution by directly appealing to facts of personal experience and not to book-knowledge.

zen-teaches-nothing-it-merely-enables-us.text: Zen teaches nothing; it merely enables us to wake up and become aware. It does not teach, it points.
